almost.functional.utils

Class Iterables

  • java.lang.Object
    • almost.functional.utils.Iterables

  • public class Iterables
extends Object
    Utility operations on an iterable.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> boolean any(Iterable<T> iterable, Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Determine if any element of an iterable matches a given predicate.
      static <T> boolean contains(Iterable<T> iterable, T value)
      Does an iterable contain a value as determined by Object.isEqual(Object, Object).
      static <T> Optional<T> find(Iterable<? extends T> iterable, Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Apply a predicate to an iterable, returning an optional of the first element where the predicate is true, or empty if no true is found.
      static <T> T find(Iterable<? extends T> iterable, Predicate<? super T> predicate, T defaultValue)
      Apply a predicate to an iterable, returning the first element where the predicate is true, or the default value if no true is found.
      static <T> void forEach(Iterable<T> i, Consumer<T> c)
      Accept a consumer for each element of an iterable.

      Apply a function to an iterable, returning the final result.
      static <F,T> Iterable<T> transform(Iterable<F> fromIterable, Function<? super F,? extends T> function)
      Create an iterable that transforms an existing iterable by applying a function to each or it's elements.

               Consumer<T> c)
        Accept a consumer for each element of an iterable.

        Parameters:

        c - the consumer to accept for each element

              Function<T,R> f)
        Apply a function to an iterable, returning the final result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the iterable and input to the function
        R - the type of the function result
        Parameters:
        i - the iterable
        f - the function to apply
        Returns:

      • find

        public static <T> Optional<T> find(Iterable<? extends T> iterable,
                   Predicate<? super T> predicate)
        Apply a predicate to an iterable, returning an optional of the first element where the predicate is true, or empty if no true is found.
        Type Parameters:
        T - they type of the iterable and predicate
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable to traverse
        predicate - the predicate to test
        Returns:
        an optional of the first element where the predicate is true, or empty if no true is found.

      • find

        public static <T> T find(Iterable<? extends T> iterable,
         Predicate<? super T> predicate,
         T defaultValue)
        Apply a predicate to an iterable, returning the first element where the predicate is true, or the default value if no true is found.
        Type Parameters:
        T - they type of the iterable, predicate and deault value
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable to traverse
        predicate - the predicate to test
        defaultValue - the default value should a value not be found
        Returns:
        the first element where the predicate is true, or the default value if no true is found.

      • any

        public static <T> boolean any(Iterable<T> iterable,
              Predicate<? super T> predicate)
        Determine if any element of an iterable matches a given predicate.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the iterable and predicate
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable to traverse
        predicate - the predicate to test
        Returns:
        true if any element matches the predicate, otherwise false.

      • contains

        public static <T> boolean contains(Iterable<T> iterable,
                   T value)
        Does an iterable contain a value as determined by Object.isEqual(Object, Object).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the iterable and object
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable
        value - the value
        Returns:
        true if iterable contain a value as determined by Object.isEqual(Object, Object).

      • transform

        public static <F,T> Iterable<T> transform(Iterable<F> fromIterable,
                          Function<? super F,? extends T> function)
        Create an iterable that transforms an existing iterable by applying a function to each or it's elements.
        Type Parameters:
        F - the type of the original elements, and the argument to the function
        T - the type of the resulting iterable, and the result of the function
        Parameters:
        fromIterable - the iterable to be transformed
        function - the function to apply to the elements
        Returns:
        an iterable that transforms an existing iterable by applying a function to each or it's elements.
